intro: Anerincleistus scortechinii, commonly known as the golden star orchid, is a tropical epiphytic plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow and green flowers that resemble stars. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, utilizing its aerial roots to absorb moisture and nutrients from the environment. Its leaves are usually broad and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native habitat. Anerincleistus scortechinii is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and unique floral display.
